entry.title: Toward a stricter query string parser
entry.summary: With most query string parsers, a lot of URIs can point to the same content. It not only mess you cache system but make your logs less expressive. To avoid those problems I just wrote a stricter query string parser.

entry.title: Designing HTTP REST APIs with NodeJS
entry.summary: Designing good HTTP services is still a hard thing despite the many tools you can find to make them with NodeJS. I'm trying to define a formal approach to architecture them by embracing the HTTP protocol nature and the RESTful principles.

entry.title: No more middlewares, please
entry.summary: Why I think middlewares are a bad thing, how I am replacing them.

entry.title: Let's Subset JavaScript
entry.summary: Currently, it's all about JavaScript and how to compile, transpile and every "ile"y things you could imagine. But what about making JavaScript smaller?

entry.title: Create Native NodeJS Modules Fallbacking To Emscripten Ones
entry.summary: Suprisingly, creating a native module is not that hard. Making it compile on any platform and gracefully handle compilation fails is a bit more tricky.

entry.title: Watching Your NodeJS Projects's Dependencies The Easy Way
entry.summary: Using watchdeps to automagically watch your project's dependencies.

entry.summary: A presentation introducing reaccess an its use on a MEAN stack.

entry.title: Match IE8 With Rework And Gulp!
entry.summary: Rework is a very powerful tool. It allows working with CSS contents in a friendly manner. Let's improve you IE8 compatibility with it.

entry.title: Detecting Bad JavaScript Performance Tests On JSPerf
entry.summary: JSPerf gives us a simple way to write JavaScript performance tests. Unfortunately, tests found aren't always well designed. Here's how to detect and avoid them.

entry.title: Revisiting The JavaScript Singleton Pattern
entry.summary: JavaScript design patterns are quite good examples to sharp your JavaScript skills. Let's take a look to the singleton pattern.

entry.title: Easily Implement Stacks (Fifo) And Queues (Lifo) With JavaScript
entry.summary: I'm currently reviewing Javascript basis for a personnal project and it appears I often use stacks and queues implicitly. Let's make it explicit and easyer to debug/use.
